title: War 1914: Punishing the Serbs
description: Dealing with the events leading up to the outbreak of the First World War, and mirroring recent events in Serbia, this report contains the diplomatic exchanges that followed the assassination of the Archduke Franz Ferdinand. Some argued for immediate and decisive military action, while others pleaded that a war should not be fought over Serbia. War broke out within four weeks. Uncovered Editions are historic official papers which have not previously been available in a popular form.
author: Tim Coates
